channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 9
item.description:
May 09, 2020 7:48 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Saturday,Â May 9.

item.title: Coronavirus: Public urged not to rush out when measures ease on May 12
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Even as barbers, hairdressers and some other businesses prepare to reopen from Tuesday, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong has urged people not to rush.

item.title: 37 mosques chip in for meals to break fast
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 37 local mosques have come together to contribute $600,000 to SGUnited Buka Puasa, a ground-up effort to provide meals for the breaking of fast to members of the Muslim community during the holy month of Ramadan.

item.title: Greater distress due to disruption in routine
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Every morning, 81-year-old Peter Lim changes into his favourite polo shirt and pants, wears his shoes and prepares to leave the house.

item.title: Coronavirus: All TCM halls can reopen from next Tuesday
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

All traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) medical halls will be allowed to open from next Tuesday, to meet the demand for such services, Health Minister Gan Kim Yong said yesterday.

item.title: Support causes beyond Covid-19: Halimah
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

President Halimah Yacob has expressed her hope that Singaporeans would extend their generosity towards underserved communities that have not been in the spotlight during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Coping without face-to-face therapy, going online for help
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The circuit breaker has been a period of extreme isolation for Mr Daniel Ler. He lives alone, works from home, has few friends to talk to, and now even has reduced access to his psychiatrist, who is not seeing patients face to face until June 1.

item.title: Coronavirus testing must be done in coordinated, strategic way: Lawrence Wong
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

As Singapore ramps up coronavirus testing to 40,000 a day, it needs to have a strategy and do it in a coordinated fashion, said Minister for National Development Lawrence Wong yesterday.

item.title: Dosage guide for Muslims with Type 2 diabetes to fast safely
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Fasting during Ramadan is one of the five pillars of Islam and practised by many Muslims, but it can be dangerous for those with Type 2 diabetes.

item.title: Dangerous journeys: Hunting pushes migratory birds to the brink
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

When these birds of a feather flock together, they make up one of the greatest animal migrations of the world, flying almost from pole to pole to escape the winter chill.

item.title: Clearing smaller dorms of coronavirus will take time, says Lawrence Wong
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of foreign workers living in dormitories who test positive for the coronavirus daily continues to be high in part because of an "active and aggressive testing regime" that sees more workers being tested each day, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: ST received over 5,000 questions on virus from Jan
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

When the coronavirus hit home in Singapore, people wanted answers.

item.title: NTU probes link between tiny air organisms and respiratory woes
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

There is life all around us, and they can be found even in the air we breathe.

item.title: Coronavirus: MOM takes 228 firms, work pass holders to task
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Since early last month, 228 companies and work pass holders have been caught flouting circuit breaker measures at workplaces and stay-home notice requirements, the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) said yesterday.

item.title: S'pore travel sector faces uncertain future amid Covid-19
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Just like many Singaporeans' travel arrangements, plans for the country's biggest biannual travel fairs are also up in the air.

item.title: Unlocking the lockdown - a strategy for the end game
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic has hit the world hard. In four months we have seen millions infected, thousands dying and the healthcare systems of even the most developed countries strained to breaking point.

item.title: Meet Spot, the safe distancing robot on trial in Bishan-AMK Park
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A four-legged robot started patrolling Bishan-Ang Mo Kio Park to remind people of safe distancing measures yesterday.

item.title: 'Sampling of drinks' case: Teen to plead guilty
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A 17-year-old youth, who is allegedly linked to a video of a teenager sampling drinks at an NTUC FairPrice supermarket before placing them back on a shelf, intends to plead guilty to one count of being a public nuisance.

item.title: Testing for Covid-19 begins for all residents, staff at homes for elderly
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Coronavirus testing has started for all 30,000 staff and residents in Singapore's residential care homes for the elderly and is expected to be finished by early next month, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: HDB resale volume falls 78% to record low
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The Housing Board (HDB) resale volume has hit a record low, plummeting 78.3 per cent last month from March, as circuit breaker measures put in place to stem the spread of the coronavirus curbed home viewings.

item.title: 768 new coronavirus cases, including nursing home worker; 328 patients discharged
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Among the 768 new Covid-19 cases announced yesterday is a staff member from a nursing home operated by Ren Ci Hospital at 10 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 8.

item.title: Woman accused of labour trafficking acquitted of 4 charges
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman, who had been accused of exploiting two female Bangladeshi performers at a Hindi music pub she managed, was acquitted of four of her charges on Wednesday following a trial.

item.title: Coronavirus curbs won't all be lifted after June 1, says minister
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Life will not go back to normal immediately after June 1, when Singapore's Covid-19 circuit breaker period comes to an end, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong during a virtual press conference yesterday.

item.title: SIA expects to make first full-year loss
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Airlines (SIA) expects to make a full-year net loss for the first time in its 48-year history, as the coronavirus pandemic continues to hammer the global aviation sector.

item.title: Man charged with visiting flat for social gathering amid coronavirus outbreak
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A 38-year-old man who is said to have left his home to attend a social gathering in a woman's flat was later served an "invite" he could not refuse - a day in court.

item.title: Mental health fallout: How Covid-19 has affected those in Singapore
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Care Hotline set up to offer extra support has seen more than 6,600 calls by the end of the month since its launch on April 10.

item.title: Coronavirus: Review of measures at care facilities after staff infections
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Infection control measures at facilities for recovering coronavirus patients have come under review, following reports of infection among staff and volunteers there.

item.title: Coronavirus: Contractors' body launches $1m fund to help smaller players
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Contractors Association Limited (Scal) has launched a $1 million initiative to help small and medium-sized construction firms hit by the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Lack of personal space, family issues bother youth
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Last month, a teenager suffering from depression committed suicide. According to her counsellor, the strain of being cooped up at home and a poor relationship with her parents contributed to her emotional turmoil, even though she had been trying to work through it.

item.title: Coronavirus: Vulnerable seniors being supported during circuit breaker
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Seniors in need are continuing to receive help as social service agencies and volunteer networks providing essential aid remain active during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: Taste of home for Bangladeshi workers as they break fast
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Bangladeshi workers in the Westlite Juniper dormitory in Mandai were able to break fast to the taste of home yesterday, thanks to snack packages from the Bangladesh High Commission.

item.title: Anxiety may cause kids to 'misbehave'
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

In the last month, 200 more children have contacted Tinkle Friend, a helpline for primary school pupils, such that more staff had to be trained to help man it.

item.title: Coronavirus: Wearable dongle among options being explored to boost tracking
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A contact tracing dongle that those without smartphones can take along when they go out is among the tech options that the Government is currently exploring as it seeks to boosts its ability to track the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Peter Lim donates $1m in meals for hospital workers
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Billionaire Peter Lim is picking up the tab for $1 million worth of meals that hospital staff can enjoy, in a show of appreciation and support for their work. At least 20,000 workers will receive food vouchers which can be used at more than 160 participating food outlets including Kopitiam, Foodfare and Fei Siong.

item.title: Over 150 seek help from charity HealthServe
item.description:
May 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Over 150 migrant workers who were feeling distressed have contacted HealthServe in the two weeks after it launched its virtual counselling clinic on April 20.

item.title: Woman arrested for assaulting police officer and refusing to wear a mask in Sun Plaza mall
item.description:
May 09, 2020 12:26 AM

When police officers arrived and requested to see her identity, she allegedly started peeling off the address sticker on her identity card.
